content.question: Assume that the government implements a deficit-reduction policy that results in changes in aggregate income and output. Then the Federal Reserve engages in monetary policy actions that reverse the changes in income and output caused by fiscal policy action. Which of the following sets of changes in taxes, government spending, and administered interest rates is most consistent with these policies?

choices.label: Taxes Government Spending Administered Interest Rates Increase Increase Decrease
Taxes Government Spending Administered Interest Rates Increase Decrease Decrease
Taxes Government Spending Administered Interest Rates Increase Decrease Increase
Taxes Government Spending Administered Interest Rates Decrease Increase No change
Taxes Government Spending Administered Interest Rates Decrease Decrease Decrease

content.answer: Taxes Government Spending Administered Interest Rates Increase Decrease Decrease
